label: Behavior 61577245
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: navigating along a fixed route (the persistent alignment between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and negligible course deviation, indicates the vessel is following a straight, predefined maritime route; the position progression follows a linear trajectory moving south-southeast, approximated by the parametric equations: lat(t) ≈ 55.9808 − 0.0238 × t, lon(t) ≈ 16.2338 + 0.0085 × t, where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed between 8.3 and 8.6 knots across the trajectory)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG changes slowly from 167.0° to 169.0°, then back to 166.0°, indicating a smooth, controlled adjustment in direction over time)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains steady at 163.0° for most of the segment, with only minor adjustments down to 162.0°, suggesting minimal rudder input and stable steering)

Behavior intent: navigating along a fixed route (the persistent alignment between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and negligible course deviation, indicates the vessel is following a straight, predefined maritime route; the position progression follows a linear trajectory moving south-southeast, approximated by the parametric equations: lat(t) ≈ 55.9808 − 0.0238 × t, lon(t) ≈ 16.2338 + 0.0085 × t, where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
